DataElement.preferredName: Lung Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Hemoglobin Adjustment Physical Examination Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The percentage, fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator for the examination of lung function by measuring the carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood where the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs, adjusted for hemoglobin, the red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lung Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Hemoglobin Adjustment Physical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the examination of lung function by measuring the carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood where the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs, adjusted for hemoglobin, the red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Property.preferredName: Carbon Monoxide Diffusing Capability Test Hemoglobin Adjustment Physical Examination
Property.preferredDefinition: A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.:The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.:The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of carbon monoxide (CO) transfer from inspired gas to pulmonary capillary blood. During the test, the subject inspires a gas containing CO and one or more tracer gases to allow determination of the gas exchanging capability of the lungs.

The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.
The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide Predictive Value Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The percentage, fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator, of the predicted value, an expression of the likelihood that a given test result correlates with the presence or absence of disease, for the diffusion capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of the likelihood that a given test result correlates with the presence or absence of disease.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: An expression of the likelihood that a given test result correlates with the presence or absence of disease.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
